greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of nonnegative integers: a(1) = 0; for n > 1, a(n) = A122111(A156552(n)).
comment: Note the indexing: the domain starts from 1, but the range includes also zero.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..105
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
mathematica: Table[If[n < 3, n - 1, Block[{k = #, m = 0}, Times @@ Power @@@ Table[k -= m; k = DeleteCases[k, 0]; {Prime@ Length@ k, m = Min@ k}, Length@ Union@ k]] &@ Catenate[ConstantArray[PrimePi[#1], #2] & @@@ FactorInteger@ #] &@ Floor@ Total@ Flatten@ MapIndexed[#1 2^(#2 - 1) &, Flatten[Table[2^(PrimePi@ #1 - 1), {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ n]]], {n, 67}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 31 2018, after _JungHwan Min_ at A122111 *)
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 30 2018
